name: OSIRIS Lab
description: OSIRIS (Organization for Security and Intelligence Research In Systems) is NYU's student-run offensive security research lab. Students compete in international CTF competitions, conduct independent security research, and develop cutting-edge security tools.
activities: Capture The Flag (CTF) competitions and training|Independent security research projects|Tool development and open-source contributions|Weekly seminars and workshops|Collaboration with industry security teams

name: Center for Cyber Security (CCS)
description: The Center for Cybersecurity at NYU Tandon is a hub for interdisciplinary research, education, and public engagement in cybersecurity. The center brings together faculty, students, and industry partners to address critical security challenges.
activities: Applied cryptography and secure systems|Network and software security|Privacy-enhancing technologies|Security policy and governance|Industry partnerships and workforce development
